description: From Middle English pinfold, punfold, punfald, variants of Middle English pundfold, pundfald, from Old English pundfald (“pinfold”), equivalent to pound (“pen, enclosure”) +‎ fold.

entries.meaning: An open enclosure for animals, especially an area where stray animals were rounded up if their owners failed to properly supervise their use of common grazing land.
examples: These drawing near the wood, where close ypent / The wicked sprites in sylvan pinfolds were […]

verbs.description: pinfold (third-person singular simple present pinfolds, present participle pinfolding, simple past and past participle pinfolded)
